Package comp3111.examsystem.entity.Exam

Class ExamDatabase

java.lang.Object
comp3111.examsystem.tools.Database<Exam>
comp3111.examsystem.entity.Exam.ExamDatabase
public class ExamDatabase extends Database<Exam>
Database for storing and accessing exam entity
Author:
Cheugn Tuen King

      public static final int EXAM_TIME_UPPER_LIMIT
      Restriction of the upper time limit of exam time. Set to -1 to remove restriction.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static ExamDatabase getInstance()
      Returns exam database singleton for retrieving, adding, updating and deleting Exam entity
      Returns:
      ExamDatabase

    • filter

      public List<Exam> filter(String name, String courseId, String published)
      Filter exams in the database based on the parameters provided. If parameters is null or empty string, filtering on associated field is not performed.
      Parameters:
      name - Exam name for filtering. Perform fuzzy matching on this field.
      courseId - Course ID for filtering. Perform exact matching on this field.
      published - Filter the published exam or not. Perform exact matching on this field.
      Returns:
      List of exams matching the parameters

    • queryByQuestion

      public List<Exam> queryByQuestion(long id)
      Search for exams containing question id provided
      Parameters:
      id - Question Id
      Returns:
      List of exams containing the question Id

    • exist

      public boolean exist(long id)
      Check if the provided exam ID exists
      Parameters:
      id - Exam id for checking
      Returns:
      Boolean determining if the exam ID provided exists

    • exist

      public boolean exist(Exam exam)
      Check if the provided exam exists by checking its ID
      Parameters:
      exam - Exam for checking
      Returns:
      Boolean determining if the exam provided exists

    • addExam

      public void addExam(Exam entity) throws Exception
      Validate and add the exam to the database. ID would be auto-changed if identical ID already exists in the database.
      Parameters:
      entity - Exam for adding
      Throws:
      Exception - The exam is null, or exam with identical name and course ID exists

    • updateExam

      public void updateExam(Exam entity) throws Exception
      Validate and update the exam provided
      Parameters:
      entity - Exam for updating
      Throws:
      Exception - The provided exam does not have id matched in the database. Perhaps add the exam instead.

    • deleteExam

      public void deleteExam(Exam entity) throws Exception
      Delete the provided exam.
      Parameters:
      entity - Exam for deleting
      Throws:
      Exception - The provided exam does not exist in the database

    • deleteExams

      public void deleteExams(List<Exam> exams) throws Exception
      Delete the list of exams provided.
      Parameters:
      exams - List of exams for deleting
      Throws:
      Exception - There exist an exam provided which does not exist in the database.

    • deleteAll

      public void deleteAll() throws Exception
      Delete all the exam in the database. For testing only.
      Throws:
      Exception - There exist an exam provided which does not exist in the database.
